description: With this MSc in Occupational Psychology, you will develop your understanding of a wide range of domains where psychology impacts the workplace.As an occupational psychologist you will apply your psychological knowledge, theory and practice to organisational issues in the workplace. You will study how to drive a positive societal change in a professional setting. This Masterâ€™s in Occupational Psychology will cover such topics, like diversity training, assessments feature a range of important social themes such as sexism in leadership, workplace racism, corruption, and organisational greenwashing.
duration: 1 Year Full Time / 2 Years Part Time
fees: FeesPlease see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
